title: Ornithology Terms Quiz
description: Test your knowledge of bird science vocabulary, from feather types and flight mechanics to migration patterns and nesting behaviors.

questions.question: What is 'plumage'?
options: The covering of feathers on a bird

questions.question: What does 'migration' refer to in ornithology?
options: The seasonal movement of birds from one region to another

questions.question: What is a 'raptor'?
options: A bird of prey, such as an eagle, hawk, or falcon

questions.question: What does 'preening' involve?
options: A bird using its beak to clean, arrange, and waterproof its feathers

questions.question: What is a 'brood'?
options: A group of young birds hatched at one time from a single clutch of eggs

questions.question: What does 'fledgling' mean?
options: A young bird that has recently grown flight feathers and is learning to fly

questions.question: What is a bird's 'gizzard'?
options: A muscular part of the stomach that grinds food, often with swallowed grit

questions.question: What does 'clutch' refer to in ornithology?
options: A group of eggs laid at one time in a nest

questions.question: What is 'molting'?
options: The periodic shedding and replacement of feathers

questions.question: What does 'passerine' refer to?
options: A member of the largest order of birds, commonly known as perching birds or songbirds

questions.question: What is 'birding'?
options: The hobby of observing and identifying birds in their natural habitat

questions.question: What are 'talons'?
options: The webbed feet of a duck
The sharp claws of a bird of prey used for catching and holding food

questions.question: What is a 'rookery'?
options: A colony of breeding birds, especially penguins or rooks
